page.title: 08RELIGIOUS LIFE
page.content: {The Church.}One clergyman covers five churches in the area. Each has a weekly service but Bryngwyn with a membership of 50 has an average of only 15 worshippers each Sunday. The majority of the congregation are older folk but some children do go. The service following a set pattern takes 45 mins. In August 20 tourists augmented the congregation. The clergy man has the assistance of an organist. Rhosgoch{Chapel}has a congregation of 10 or so each week. Chapels have big anniversary services.An organ and a piano are playd by Mrs Mills. Flowers are always kept on the table at the front. Ministers are booked by the secretary and are paid for each service. Preachers are not easy to come by. Dedications, weddings and funerals are all done at Rhosgoch. The vicar has close ties with the chapel.
